headline: United (UAL) Q2 Earnings: How Key Metrics Compare to Wall Street Estimates

headline: What United's New Profit Forecast Signals for Airlines
summary: Barbara Doran, BD8 Capaital Partners founder and CIO, reacts to United Airlines Holdings' new profit outlook for this year. The airline now expects full-year adjusted earnings of $9 to $11 a share, United said in a statement.

headline: United Airlines shares slip as carrier flags earnings hit from Newark disruptions
summary: Investing.com - Shares of United Airlines slipped in premarket U.S. trading on Thursday after the carrier’s third-quarter profit estimate slightly disappointed expectations.

headline: United Airlines posts earnings beat, but cuts profit outlook
summary: United Airlines (UAL) posted second quarter adjusted earnings of $3.87 per share, which is above the Bloomberg consensus estimate of $3.84. Operating revenue was $15.2 billion, which was shy of the $15.33 billion estimate. The company also cut guidance. It sees full year adjusted earnings of $9 to $11 per share. It had been $11.50 to $13.50. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: United: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Chicago-based company said it had net income of $2.97. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $3.87 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.

raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the Chicago-based company said it had net income of $2.97. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were $3.87 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.

headline: United Airlines (NASDAQ:UAL) Misses Q2 Sales Targets
summary: Airline company United Airlines Holdings (NASDAQ:UAL) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales only rose 1.7% year on year to $15.24 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.87 per share was 1.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: United Airlines Reports Second-Quarter Profit, Sees Third-Quarter Positive Inflection in Both Supply and Demand
summary: United Airlines (UAL) today reported a second-quarter profit, ahead of Wall Street expectations, and grew both earnings and pre-tax margin in the first half of 2025 versus the first half of 2024.
